definition: to influence or gently urge by caressing or flattering : wheedle
to draw, gain, or persuade by means of gentle urging or flattery
examples: unable to coax an answer out of him
coaxing consumers to buy new cars

definition: to manipulate with great perseverance and usually with considerable effort toward a desired state or activity
examples: is optimistic that stem cells can be coaxed into growing into replacement tissue for failing organs
